phonebook.hashes

类 OpenAddressingHashTable

  • java.lang.Object
    • phonebook.hashes.OpenAddressingHashTable
  • 所有已实现的接口:
    HashTable
    直接已知子类:
    LinearProbingHashTable, OrderedLinearProbingHashTable, QuadraticProbingHashTable

    public abstract class OpenAddressingHashTable
extends java.lang.Object
implements HashTable

    OpenAddressingHashTable is an abstract class that models openly addressed hash tables, i.e hash tables which store the key-value pairs within the table itself instead of using the table to store pointers to separate buckets. A OpenAddressingHashTable instance needs to provide amortized constant time for searches, insertions and deletions" soft " or " hard "). It also needs to resize the table when it's getting full or empty, otherwise keys will not be able to be inserted or we will be wasting a lot of memory respectively. This is in contradiction to SeparateChainingHashTable instances, where resizing is a suggested operation meant to improve efficiency.

    Essentially, this class allows us to re-use some fields and methods that are common across all of your openly addressed hash tables. For example, all openly addressed HashTable instances need to contain a one-dimensional array over KVPair instances, and they also need ab accepted constant for the tombstone and a store for a boolean variable that determines what kind of deletion we are doing (" soft " or " hard ").

    DO NOT EDIT THE **** EXISTING ****** FUNCTIONALITY OF THIS CLASS! If there is a method or field that you want all of your openly addressed hash tables to see, you should add it to this class as a protected field.

    另请参阅:
    HashTable, KVPair, SeparateChainingHashTable, LinearProbingHashTable, OrderedLinearProbingHashTable, QuadraticProbingHashTable

    • 字段概要

      字段 
      限定符和类型 字段和说明
      protected int count
      Initialized to zero, this variable should hold the number of key-value pairs stored in this.
      protected PrimeGenerator primeGenerator
      A PrimeGenerator instance which will be used for resizings of the table.
      protected boolean softFlag
      A store of the user's preference towards deletion type.
      protected KVPair[] table
      A 1D array over KVPair instances which will hold our Key-Value pairs.
      protected KVPair TOMBSTONE
      A final variable which will be used in soft deletion across all our openly addressed hash tables.

    • 字段详细资料

      • TOMBSTONE

        protected KVPair TOMBSTONE
        A final variable which will be used in soft deletion across all our openly addressed hash tables.

      • table

        protected KVPair[] table
        A 1D array over KVPair instances which will hold our Key-Value pairs.

      • primeGenerator

        protected PrimeGenerator primeGenerator
        A PrimeGenerator instance which will be used for resizings of the table. We must always keep the size of the Hash Table prime, and this instance will help us with that.
        另请参阅:
        PrimeGenerator

      • count

        protected int count
        Initialized to zero, this variable should hold the number of key-value pairs stored in this.

      • softFlag

        protected boolean softFlag
        A store of the user's preference towards deletion type. true means soft deletion, false means hard.

        public OpenAddressingHashTable()

    • 方法详细资料

      • hash

        protected int hash(java.lang.String key)
        A hash function that uses the default hash code for String types, but masks the top bit to avoid negative hashes.
        参数:
        key - The String key to find the hash code of.
        返回:
        The hash code of the parameter String as produced by String.hashCode(), but with the top bit masked.
        另请参阅:
        String.hashCode()

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        A public Object.toString() overriding we provide for you. Allows you to print the table to stdout to help you visualize it. Useful for debugging.
        覆盖:
        toString 在类中 java.lang.Object

      • rehash

        protected void rehash()
